intro: Lastreopsis killipii, commonly known as the Killip's lastreopsis, is a rare and unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Native to the coastal areas of southern California, it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
